('18', 0, 0, 1, 0) VOL. 17 : 1 MAY, 1919 28 SEPTEMBER, 1919 1
('18', 0, 1, 2, 43) 1. SATYAGRAHA LEAFLET NO.
('18', 0, 2, 3, 69) May 1, 1919
('18', 0, 3, 4, 81) BROTHERS AND SISTERS, Letters continue to pour in containing complaints about the so called inactivity regarding Mr. Hornimans deportation.
('18', 0, 3, 5, 221) Most of these letters are anonymous.
('18', 0, 3, 6, 258) One of them states that it does not matter even if violence be the result of our holding large meetings, etc.
('18', 0, 3, 7, 368) It adds that we shall gain nothing without violence and that without it we shall not be able to bring Mr. Horniman back to India.
('18', 0, 3, 8, 498) It is simple enough to give a reply to the foregoing along the lines of satyagraha: If violence be the condition of Mr. Hornimans return to India, then satyagrahis have to be content with separation.
('18', 0, 3, 9, 698) But there is absolutely no fear of any such result from non violence.
('18', 0, 3, 10, 768) We can certainly bring about his return by satyagraha.
('18', 0, 3, 11, 823) Indeed we can hasten it by satyagraha alonesatyagraha consists at times in civil disobedience and other times in civil obedience.
('18', 0, 3, 12, 953) It consists at times in declaring hartal, or holding large public meetings or arranging processions and other times in refraining from any one or all of these things.
('18', 0, 3, 13, 1120) Satyagrahis may not do a single thing that would bring about or encourage violence.
('18', 0, 3, 14, 1204) At the present moment people are in a ferment, they are angry and it is likely that large meetings, process ions, hartals may increase excitement and even end in violence.
('18', 0, 3, 15, 1376) Both the people and the police are liable to err and both may have to suffer for the mistake of either.
('18', 0, 3, 16, 1480) It is therefore clear that satyagrahis ought to prevent such untoward results by every means at their disposal.
('18', 0, 3, 17, 1592) Therein lies their satyagraha.
('18', 0, 3, 18, 1623) The nation can only rise higher by reason of the effort to be put forth, the discipline to be undergone and the soul force to be exerted for the attainment of such an end.
('18', 0, 3, 19, 1795) When the people have disciplined themselves to remain calm, to curb anger, to handle processions with self restraint, to bring about hartals without threat or violence, when volunteers are so trained that the people listen to and act according to their instructions, we are in a position to hold meetings, declare hartals and arrange processions.
('18', 0, 3, 20, 2142) It is enough to see that the just demands of a people so trained become irresistible.
('18', 0, 3, 21, 2228) The present activity is directed towards the attainment of that end and I urge all to read this leaflet and those who are able to help, to go to the Satyagraha Sabha offices and have their names registered as helpers.
('18', 1, 0, 1, 2446) 2 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('18', 1, 1, 2, 2486) Now let us for a moment examine, not from the satyagraha but from the ordinary standpoint the proposition that we can by violence bring about Mr. Hornimans early return or accomplish our other objects.
('18', 1, 1, 3, 2688) I believe that what is true and possible in other countries is not necessarily true and possible in Hindustan.
('18', 1, 1, 4, 2799) India has from time immemorial received a different training.
('18', 1, 1, 5, 2861) In India one cannot recall a time when the whole people were engaged in the use of brute force.
('18', 1, 1, 6, 2957) It is my belief that India deliberately abandoned universal use of brute force.
('18', 1, 1, 7, 3037) We have noted the results of violence in the Punjab.
('18', 1, 1, 8, 3090) Ahmeda bad is still suffering.
('18', 1, 1, 9, 3121) We shall hereafter be able to measure the full dreadful effect of violence.
('18', 1, 1, 10, 3197) One such effect is the suspension of civil disobedience.
('18', 1, 1, 11, 3254) We ought, therefore, to consider as erroneous the belief that by violence we can hasten Mr. Hornimans return or gain other objects.
('18', 1, 1, 12, 3386) In one of the letters received by me it is argued that satyagrahis have no right to advise others to refrain from demonstrations, etc., even if they choose to do so.
('18', 1, 1, 13, 3552) But we observe at the present moment in Hindustan a vast number of people desirous of taking part in all satyagraha activities other than civil disobedience.
('18', 1, 1, 14, 3710) This state of things causes as much anxiety as pleasure.
('18', 1, 1, 15, 3767) It throws a tremendous responsibility upon satyagrahis.
('18', 1, 1, 16, 3823) One of them is this: If the people are interested in satyagraha and are desirous of experiencing its wonderful results, satyagrahis have to so act that the people may become trained to participate in the movement in strict accordance with its principles and its fundamental principle is adherence to truth and non violence to person or property and when the people have accepted this principle the whole world will have a demonstration of the efficacy of satyagraha.
('18', 1, 2, 17, 4290) M. K. GANDHI
('18', 1, 3, 18, 4303) Printed by Rustom N. Vatchaghandy at the Sanj Vartaman Press, Nos.
('18', 1, 3, 19, 4370) 22 24 26, Mint Road, Fort, Bombay.
('18', 1, 4, 20, 4405) From the printed original preserved in Gandhi Smarak Sangrahalaya, Delhi.
('18', 1, 4, 21, 4479) Courtesy: H. S. L. Polak
('18', 2, 0, 1, 4504) VOL. 17 : 1 MAY, 1919 28 SEPTEMBER, 1919 3
('18', 2, 1, 2, 4547) 2. SATYAGRAHA LEAFLET NO.
('18', 2, 2, 3, 4573) May 2, 1919
('18', 2, 3, 4, 4585) WHEN IS SATYAGRAHA GOING TO BE RESUMED ?
('18', 2, 4, 5, 4626) When is satyagraha going to be resumed? is the question many have been asking me.
('18', 2, 4, 6, 4708) There are two answers.
('18', 2, 4, 7, 4731) One is that satyagraha has not at all ceased.
('18', 2, 4, 8, 4777) As long as we practise truth, and ask others to do so, so long satyagraha can never be said to have ceased.
('18', 2, 4, 9, 4885) And if all practise truth, and refrain from violence to person and property, we would immediately get what we want.
('18', 2, 4, 10, 5001) But when all are not prepared to do so, when satyagrahis are only a handful, then we have to devise other methods deducible from satyagraha.
('18', 2, 4, 11, 5142) One such method is Civil Disobedience.
('18', 2, 4, 12, 5181) I have already explained the reason why this civil disobedience has been for the time being suspended.
('18', 2, 4, 13, 5284) As long as we know that there is every likelihood, bordering on certainty, of rioting and violence following civil disobedience, so long disobedience of laws cannot be regarded as civil disobedience, but it is disobedience that is thoughtless, uncivil, and devoid of truth.
('18', 2, 4, 14, 5558) Satyagrahis may never commit such disobedience.
('18', 2, 4, 15, 5606) The resumption of civil disobedience can, however, be hastened by the satyagrahis completely fulfilling their duty.
('18', 2, 4, 16, 5722) My confidence in satyagrahis has led me to assume that we shall be fitted for resuming civil disobedience in about two months, i.e., if the Rowlatt legislation is not withdrawn in the meantime, we may resume civil disobedience by the beginning of July next.
('18', 2, 4, 17, 5980) In provisionally fixing this period, I am guided by the following considerations: One of them is that we shall have by that time spread our message throughout the country, viz., that during the pendency of civil disobedience, no one, under cover of satyagraha, or the pretence of helping it, should resort to rioting or violence.
('18', 2, 4, 18, 6310) It may be hoped that the people being convinced that the true interest of the country will be served by acting in accordance with the message will preserve peace.
('18', 2, 4, 19, 6473) And peace thus voluntarily sustained will materially contribute towards Indias progress.
('18', 2, 4, 20, 6562) But it is possible that India may not understand satyagraha to this extent.
('18', 2, 4, 21, 6638) In that case, there is one more hope of the non recurrence of violence, though the condition upon which the hope is based is humiliating for us.
('18', 2, 4, 22, 6783) It is open to the satyagrahis, however, to avail of this condition.
('18', 2, 4, 23, 6851) Indeed, it becomes their duty to resume satyagraha under such conditions.
('18', 2, 4, 24, 6925) The military
('18', 3, 0, 1, 6938) 4 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('18', 3, 1, 2, 6978) dispositions that are now going on will naturally ensure non recurrence of violence that is so detrimental to the country.
('18', 3, 1, 3, 7101) The recent outbreaks were all so sudden that the Government were not prepared to cope with them there and then.
('18', 3, 1, 4, 7213) But the Government arrangements are quite likely to be completed in two months time and breach of public peace will then be well nigh impossible, and therefore also conscious or unconscious abuse of satyagraha.
('18', 3, 1, 5, 7424) Under such a state of things, the satyagrahis may, without any fear of disturbance, commit civil disobedience and thereby demonstrate that not violence but satyagraha alone can help us to secure justice.
('18', 3, 2, 6, 7628) M. K. GANDHI
('18', 3, 3, 7, 7641) Printed by Rustom N. Vatchaghandy at the Sanj Vartaman Press, Nos.
('18', 3, 3, 8, 7708) 22 24 26, Mint Road, Fort, Bombay.
('18', 3, 4, 9, 7743) From the printed original preserved in Gandhi Smarak Sangrahalaya.
('18', 3, 4, 10, 7810) Courtesy: H. S. L. Polak
('18', 3, 5, 11, 7835) 3. SATYAGRAHA LEAFLET NO.
('18', 3, 6, 12, 7861) May 3, 1919
('18', 3, 7, 13, 7873) SATYAGRAHA MOVEMENT
('18', 3, 8, 14, 7893) BROTHERS AND SISTERS, A proper understanding of two things in satyagraha enables one to solve without effort many doubts.
('18', 3, 8, 15, 8015) One of them is that a satyagrahi never does anything out of fear from without.
('18', 3, 8, 16, 8094) He should fear only God.
('18', 3, 8, 17, 8119) By bearing this thing in mind, we shall clearly see why we have suspended civil disobedience, why over Mr. Hornimans deportation we have not declared hartal, not held Iarge meetings and not arranged processions.
('18', 3, 8, 18, 8331) In so refraining we have not been actuated, if we are true satyagrahis, by fear, but purely by a sense of duty.
('18', 3, 8, 19, 8443) The more a satyagrahi fulfils his duty as such, the nearer he brings victory.
('18', 3, 8, 20, 8521) The other thing to be remembered and which is at the present moment perhaps of greater importance than the first is that a satyagrahi never desires to reach the goal by harbouring or increasing ill will or hatred against his opponent.
('18', 3, 8, 21, 8756) He will look upon him even as a friend and yet ever resist the wrong done by him without bearing malice towards him.
('18', 3, 8, 22, 8873) By such conduct worthy of a satyagrahi, causes conducing to enmity will decrease and both parties will acknowledge and avoid mistakes.
('18', 3, 8, 23, 9008) We know the Rowlatt legislation to be altogether bad, but
('18', 4, 0, 1, 9066) VOL. 17 : 1 MAY, 1919 28 SEPTEMBER, 1919 5
('18', 4, 1, 2, 9109) that is no reason for harbouring ill will against the Government.
('18', 4, 1, 3, 9175) The harbouring of it will in no way enable us the better to assess that evil legislation, or to advance the movement against it.
('18', 4, 1, 4, 9304) On the contrary, such ill will can only damage the movement.
('18', 4, 1, 5, 9365) For, obsessed by it, we refuse to understand or weigh the opponents argument.
('18', 4, 1, 6, 9443) We thus disable ourselves from producing the necessary impression upon the opponent and to that extent retard victory if we do not make it impossible.
('18', 4, 1, 7, 9594) We are aware that the questions regarding Turkey, etc., have caused greater hurt to our Mahomedan brethren than has been caused to Hindus, Mahomedans and others by the Rowlatt legislation.
('18', 4, 1, 8, 9783) But they cannot solve their difficulties by ill will.
('18', 4, 1, 9, 9837) These difficulties can only be solved by proper deliberation, by properly framing and publishing their demands and by firm adherence thereto.
('18', 4, 1, 10, 9979) So doing, they can enlist the help of the Hindus, Parsis, Christians, in fact, the whole world, and thus make their demands irresistible.
('18', 4, 1, 11, 10117) If we harbour anger or ill will against the Government on account of the Rowlatt legislation, or Islamic or other questions, and therefore resort to violence, we shall be powerless even to consolidate Indian opinion, let alone the worlds opinion.
('18', 4, 1, 12, 10364) The gulf between the English and ourselves will widen and we shall be no nearer the goal.
('18', 4, 1, 13, 10454) Victory attained by violence is tantamount to a defeat, for it is momentary.
('18', 4, 1, 14, 10531) Then there is increase of ill will between both the parties and each prepares to give battle to the other.
('18', 4, 1, 15, 10638) There is no such untoward end to satyagraha.
('18', 4, 1, 16, 10683) A satyagrahi by reason of suffering for his principles draws towards himself universal sympathy and even melts the heart of the so called enemy.
('18', 4, 1, 17, 10828) Had we not erred in Ahmedabad and Viramgam, the history of the movement would have been written differently.
('18', 4, 1, 18, 10937) There would have been no increase of ill will between the English and ourselves, no military dispositions such as we see about us and yet our determination to get rid of the Rowlatt legislation would have remained just as firm, the movement against it would have gone much further forward, probably by this time it might have been crowned with success, resulting at the same time in a bridging of the gulf between the English and ourselves.
('18', 4, 1, 19, 11378) It is, however, never too late to mend.
('18', 4, 1, 20, 11418) We can retrace our steps.
('18', 4, 1, 21, 11444) The retracing consists in curbing anger and ill will against the English and therefore refraining from violence.
('18', 4, 1, 22, 11557) As a matter of fact, the mistake in passing the Rowlatt legislation is not of the English nation, nor of the English in India.
('18', 4, 1, 23, 11684) It is purely of those in authority.
('18', 4, 1, 24, 11720) Nations are often ignorant of what is done in their names.
('18', 4, 1, 25, 11779) The powers that be do not make deliberate
('18', 5, 0, 1, 11821) 6 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('18', 5, 1, 2, 11861) mistakes, they act as they think fit.
('18', 5, 1, 3, 11899) That fact, however, does not cause the people any the less harm and therefore, whilst we harbour no ill will against those in authority, we spare no pains in taking effective steps for mending the mistake, but regarding it only as such and no more, we refrain from violence and secure its reversal by self suffering.
('18', 5, 2, 4, 12216) M. K. GANDHI
('18', 5, 3, 5, 12229) Printed by Rustom N. Vatchaghandy at the Sanj Vartaman Press, Nos.
('18', 5, 3, 6, 12296) 22 24 26, Mint Road, Fort, Bombay.
('18', 5, 4, 7, 12331) From the printed original preserved in Gandhi Smarak Sangrahalaya, Delhi.
('18', 5, 4, 8, 12405) Courtesy: H. S. L. Polak
('18', 5, 5, 9, 12430) 4. LETTER TO J. M. WILSON
('18', 5, 6, 10, 12456) May 3, 1919 I have read the Bihar Planters Association Memorial 1 to the Government.
('18', 5, 6, 11, 12541) Your Association has done itself and me a cruel injus tice.
('18', 5, 6, 12, 12601) But I will not answer the charge brought by your Association.
('18', 5, 6, 13, 12663) Time is on my side and it will show you the error of a judgment hastily pronounced.
('18', 5, 7, 14, 12747) M. K. G.
('18', 5, 8, 15, 12756) From a photostat: S.N. 6578
('18', 5, 9, 16, 12784) 5. SATYAGRAHA LEAFLET NO.
('18', 5, 10, 17, 12810) May 4, 1919
('18', 5, 11, 18, 12822) SATYAGRAHA IS IMPOSSIBLE SO LONG AS THERE IS ILL WILL
('18', 5, 12, 19, 12876) BROTHERS AND SISTERS, We have seen in our last leaflet that the actions of a satyagrahi should not be prompted by fear from without but by the voice from within, and that a satyagrahi should not think of attaining his objects by harbouring ill will towards his opponent but should win him over by his friendliness.
('18', 5, 12, 20, 13191) I see that many hesitate to accept the second proposition.
('18', 5, 12, 21, 13250) They argue: How can we help being angry with wrong doers?
('18', 5, 12, 22, 13308) It is against human nature to do otherwise.
('18', 5, 12, 23, 13352) How can we
('18', 5, 13, 24, 13363) 1 From J. M. Wilson, secretary, Bihar Planters Association, to the secretary to the Government of India, Home Department, Simla, dated 26 4 1919, criticizing Gandhijis activities.
('18', 5, 13, 25, 13543) S.N. 6578
('18', 6, 0, 1, 13553) VOL. 17 : 1 MAY, 1919 28 SEPTEMBER, 1919 7
('18', 6, 1, 2, 13596) separate the wrong from the wrong doer?
('18', 6, 1, 3, 13636) How is it possible to direct our anger against the wrong without directing it against the wrongdoer? A father, far from getting angry with his son, often expresses his disapproval of wrong action by taking suffering on his own person.
('18', 6, 1, 4, 13871) Only on such mutual conduct is continuance of friendly relations between father and son possible.
('18', 6, 1, 5, 13969) These relations cease with the ceasing of such conduct.
('18', 6, 1, 6, 14025) It is our daily lot to go through these experiences and hence the proverb, Let quarrels perish. We can live in peace and be free from our fearful position only if we apply the domestic law to our relations with the Government.
('18', 6, 1, 7, 14252) The doubt need not be raised whether the domestic law can at all be extended to our relations with the Government, and whether the law of love does not for its operation require reciprocity.
('18', 6, 1, 8, 14443) In satyagraha, both the parties need not be satyagrahis.
('18', 6, 1, 9, 14500) Where both the parties are satyagrahis, there is no play for satyagraha, no opportunity for the test of love.
('18', 6, 1, 10, 14610) Insistence on truth can come into play only when one party practises untruth or injustice.
('18', 6, 1, 11, 14701) Only then can love be tested.
('18', 6, 1, 12, 14731) True friendship is put to the test only when one party disregards the obligations of friendship.
('18', 6, 1, 13, 14828) We stand to lose everything when we are angry against the Government.
('18', 6, 1, 14, 14898) Mutual distrust and mutual ill will are thereby augmented.
('18', 6, 1, 15, 14957) But if we act without in the least being angry with the Government, but also without being cowed down by their armed force, and without submitting to what we believe to be injustice, injustice would of itself be removed and we would easily attain the equality which is our goal.
('18', 6, 1, 16, 15236) This equality does not depend on our power to answer their brute force with brute force, but on our ability to stand our ground without fear of brute force, and real fearlessness is not possible without love.
('18', 6, 1, 17, 15445) A clear victory for satyagraha is impossible so long as there is ill will.
('18', 6, 1, 18, 15520) But those who believe themselves to be weak are incapable of loving.
('18', 6, 1, 19, 15589) Let then our first act every morning be to make the following resolve for the day: I shall not fear anyone on earth.
('18', 6, 1, 20, 15706) I shall fear only God; I shall not bear ill will towards anyone.
('18', 6, 1, 21, 15771) I shall not submit to injustice from anyone.
('18', 6, 1, 22, 15816) I shall conquer untruth by truth and in resisting untruth I shall put up with all suffering.
('18', 6, 2, 23, 15909) M. K. GANDHI
('18', 6, 3, 24, 15922) Printed by Rustom N. Vatchaghandy at the Sanj Vartaman Press, Nos.
('18', 6, 3, 25, 15989) 22 24 26, Mint Road, Fort, Bombay.
('18', 6, 4, 26, 16024) From the printed original preserved in Gandhi Smarak Sangrahalaya, Delhi.

('18', 7, 0, 1, 16123) 8 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('18', 7, 1, 2, 16163) 6. LETTER TO C. F. ANDREWS
('18', 7, 2, 3, 16190) BOMBAY, [May 4, 1919]
('18', 7, 3, 4, 16212) MY DEAR CHARLIE, I cannot get the time to send you a booka mere letter gives me no satisfaction.
('18', 7, 3, 5, 16309) I feel so confident that your view of vows can be shown to be wrong.
('18', 7, 3, 6, 16378) Your interpretation of the action of Rama shows that you have not understood it properly.
('18', 7, 3, 7, 16468) And what is the meaning of Swean in the passage from the Bible quoted by you?
('18', 7, 3, 8, 16546) May not your interpretation of that passage also be at fault?
('18', 7, 3, 9, 16608) To me the life of Jesus was one simple vow from which no earthly power could oust him.
('18', 7, 3, 10, 16695) Your two vows mentioned in your letter were parody.
('18', 7, 3, 11, 16747) They were no subjects for taking vows over.
('18', 7, 3, 12, 16791) Why should a man hesitate to stand before his Maker and say: Please, Sir, with your help I shall never tell an untruth?
('18', 7, 3, 13, 16911) But I cant stand before my Maker and say, I shall never forsake this sty or that. I may not be clear enough, but you will admit I am frank enough, and how can Love help being that ?
('18', 7, 3, 14, 17093) Did you ascertain why the flogging was administered?
('18', 7, 3, 15, 17146) I should like to know.
('18', 7, 3, 16, 17169) As you know The [Bombay] Chronicle has suspended publication by reason of the order of pre censorship.
('18', 7, 3, 17, 17272) Young India will therefore be turned into a bi weekly.
('18', 7, 3, 18, 17327) Later it may become a daily.
('18', 7, 3, 19, 17356) It is to be published under my supervision.
('18', 7, 3, 20, 17400) Can you find time to write for it?
('18', 7, 3, 21, 17435) You may write on swadeshi, Hindu Muslim unity, satyagraha, Rowlatt legislation.
('18', 7, 3, 22, 17515) We cannot accept the Rowlatt Bill even under the reservation suggested by you, namely, that it is not to be enforced without the previous sanction of the Legislative Council.
('18', 7, 3, 23, 17690) Our objection is not merely that it may be misapplied, but we object also to the arbitrary procedure laid down in it for the trial of offences enumerated in it.
('18', 7, 3, 24, 17851) I would not let even a supposed anarchist be tried summarily or under a special procedural subversion of judicial checks and certainly not under any ordinary law giving extraordinary powers.
('18', 7, 3, 25, 18042) Exceptional powers have been reserved for exceptional situations.
('18', 7, 3, 26, 18108) Executive authority cannot be allowed to deal with exceptional situations in anticipation.
('18', 7, 3, 27, 18199) Do please remain by the side of Shraddhanandji as long as it is necessary.
('18', 7, 3, 28, 18274) And when you are free, I would so like you to come
('18', 8, 0, 1, 18325) VOL. 17 : 1 MAY, 1919 28 SEPTEMBER, 1919 9
('18', 8, 1, 2, 18368) down, so that we may review that situation.
('18', 8, 1, 3, 18412) Yes, in the midst of all the carnage, prosecutions, martial law, military dispositions, I find the law of love answering fully and being abundantly proved.
('18', 8, 1, 4, 18568) With love to you and Swamiji,
('18', 8, 2, 5, 18598) Ever yours, MOHAN
('18', 8, 3, 6, 18616) From the manuscript of Mahadev Desais Diary.
('18', 8, 3, 7, 18661) Courtesy: Narayan Desai
('18', 8, 4, 8, 18685) 7. LETTER TO MAULANA ABDUL BARI
('18', 8, 5, 9, 18717) [BOMBAY, May 4, 1919]
('18', 8, 6, 10, 18739) MAULANA ABDUL BARI 1, I think there is a lack of consolidated Mahomedan opinion on Islamic questions.
('18', 8, 6, 11, 18841) Everybody feels keenly and nobody comes forward with a reasoned and representative statement.
('18', 8, 6, 12, 18935) I wish there were one by the ulema.
('18', 8, 6, 13, 18971) It would not matter a bit if it was presented in Urdu or Arabic.
('18', 8, 6, 14, 19036) An accurate translation can be easily made.
('18', 8, 6, 15, 19080) I immensely like your idea of a mixed Hindu Mahomedan commission to investigate causes of discord among the two communities and to suggest remedies leading to permanent unity.
('18', 8, 6, 16, 19256) I think however that this is not the proper time for it.
('18', 8, 6, 17, 19313) The energy of everybody is and must be concentrated upon the Rowlatt legislation, Islamic questions and Reforms.
('18', 8, 6, 18, 19426) Probably we shall come much closer together in the process of getting these questions solved to the satisfaction of the whole of India and, at the end of a settlement of these questions, a commission such as you have suggested can do much effective work.
('18', 8, 7, 19, 19681) Yours sincerely, M. K. GANDHI
('18', 8, 8, 20, 19711) From the manuscript of Mahadev Desais Diary.
('18', 8, 8, 21, 19756) Courtesy: Narayan Desai

('18', 9, 0, 1, 19865) 10 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('18', 9, 1, 2, 19906) 8. SATYAGRAHA LEAFLET NO.
('18', 9, 2, 3, 19932) May 5, 1919
('18', 9, 3, 4, 19944) SATYAGRAHA HARTAL NEXT SUNDAY
('18', 9, 4, 5, 19974) FASTING FOR 24 HOURS AND RELIGIOUS DEVOTION IN EVERY HOME
('18', 9, 5, 6, 20032) BROTHERS AND SISTERS, Bombay has borne with great calmness the separation of Mr. Horniman.
('18', 9, 5, 7, 20123) The long sustained calmness observed by Bombay under unendurable circumstances had demonstrated its capacity for self restraint.
('18', 9, 5, 8, 20252) But the discussions at the meetings of the Satyagraha Sabha and reports of popular discussions show that the minds of the people are by no means appeased.
('18', 9, 5, 9, 20407) They are desirous of publicly expressing their grief and feelings in some way or other.
('18', 9, 5, 10, 20495) The desire is and must be irrepressible.
('18', 9, 5, 11, 20536) The people will never forget what Mr. Horni man has done for them.
('18', 9, 5, 12, 20603) He has given them a new life, a new hope and there is no doubt that they have remained calm in the hope that an occasion would be provided for them to mark their pure affection for Mr. Horniman.
('18', 9, 5, 13, 20798) The Satyagraha Sabha last night decided after mature deliberation that next Sunday, 11th instant, should be the day of observance of hartal, fasting for 24 hours reckoning from previous evening, and private religious devotion in every home.
('18', 9, 5, 14, 21039) The first suggestion, i.e., hartal, is applicable to the city of Bombay.
('18', 9, 5, 15, 21112) In times of unrest, such as we are passing through, it does not seem proper to declare hartal in other places.
('18', 9, 5, 16, 21223) Not to observe it in other places is for the people thereof an act of self restraint and in the city of Bombay, too, it is to be confined to independent business men.
('18', 9, 5, 17, 21390) Those who are employed in public or private offices are in no way to suspend business unless they obtain leave.
('18', 9, 5, 18, 21502) There should be no pressure exerted upon anybody, no force used against anyone with a view to inducing suspension.
('18', 9, 5, 19, 21617) For suspension brought about by force is no suspension, for a mind acted upon by force continues to contemplate the act from which it is restrained by force.
('18', 9, 5, 20, 21775) We are bound not only not to interfere with a man who wants to open a shop or a ghariwalla who wishes to ply for hire, but to afford him every protection.
('18', 9, 5, 21, 21930) I hope that both men and women in Bombay and elsewhere who have no religious or medical objection will observe the fast and devote the day to religious contemplation and try to
('18', 10, 0, 1, 22107) VOL. 17 : 1 MAY, 1919 28 SEPTEMBER, 1919 11
('18', 10, 1, 2, 22151) understand the true nature of satyagraha by recalling the illustrations of satyagraha from their own scriptures.
('18', 10, 1, 3, 22264) We shall consider hereafter the efficacy of fasting as an aid to national progress, to the development of national ideals and to the attainment of restraint over our passions such as hunger, etc.
('18', 10, 1, 4, 22460) For the time being, it is enough that we observe an absolutely voluntary satyagraha hartal next Sunday in the city of Bombay; we observe a fast everywhere and engage in private religious devotion in a spirit of calmness and love.
('18', 10, 1, 5, 22690) We shall thereby add to our honour and speed Mr. Hornimans return.
('18', 10, 2, 6, 22757) M. K. GANDHI

('18', 10, 6, 12, 22997) LABURNUM ROAD, BOMBAY, May 5, I919
('18', 10, 7, 13, 23032) DEAR MR. MAFFEY, I thank you for your two letters and your telegram.
('18', 10, 7, 14, 23101) Your assurance has given me the greatest relief.
('18', 10, 7, 15, 23150) It saddens me to hear that the Viceroy had to give up his holiday.
('18', 10, 7, 16, 23217) I hope, however, that the strain has not proved too much for his health.
('18', 10, 7, 17, 23290) I enclose herewith some of my recent leaflets.
('18', 10, 7, 18, 23337) You will glance through them only if you have a few moments to spare.
('18', 10, 7, 19, 23407) I observe that Moulvi Rafiuddin Ahmed has suggested that some definite reassuring announcement be made regarding Islamic questi ons.
('18', 10, 7, 20, 23540) What is an armed peace worth if it is not followed up by real contentment and you will never have real contentment unless Mahomedan sentiment is conciliated and Rowlatt legislation with drawn.
('18', 10, 7, 21, 23733) Probably you know that Mahomedan women and children too take the liveliest interest in the questions of Khilafat, Palestine and the Holy Mecca.
('18', 10, 7, 22, 23877) Regarding the Rowlatt legislation, it may be argued that agitators have poisoned the public mind, but whether such be the case or not, the fact is that the public thoroughly distrust that legislation and how
('18', 11, 0, 1, 24085) 12 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('18', 11, 1, 2, 24126) can you withstand emphatically expressed public opinion?
('18', 11, 1, 3, 24183) What you see in India today is not a revolutionary plot.
('18', 11, 1, 4, 24240) I am not prepared to say that there are no men entertaining wild dreams of revolution.
('18', 11, 1, 5, 24327) But I do say that the large bodies of men who have taken part in the acts of violence have simply in a wild and furious manner given vent to their pentup feelings which is a mad protest but nothing more.
('18', 11, 1, 6, 24531) Bolshevism has not yet entered India.
('18', 11, 1, 7, 24569) But I would like you to consider whether you can prevent its entry or prevent mad acts of violence without endorsing the doctrine of satyagraha.
('18', 11, 1, 8, 24714) I ask you to believe with me that it is not so much the military dispositions as satyagraha that is the restraining force.
('18', 11, 1, 9, 24837) I think, it is commonly admitted that violence could not have been avoided in spite of the elaborate military precautions if the restraining and sobering influence of satyagraha had not been there when Mr. Horniman was deported.
('18', 11, 1, 10, 25066) Now I come to a less thorny topic, probably a topic on which we may meet.
('18', 11, 1, 11, 25140) I enclose herewith the form containing the swadeshi vow.
('18', 11, 1, 12, 25197) What a great thing it would be if the Viceroy would take the vow!
('18', 11, 1, 13, 25263) You will see that Englishmen can take it just as easily as Indians.
('18', 11, 1, 14, 25331) Do please submit it to H. E. when you think he has time to go through it.
('18', 11, 1, 15, 25405) Even if the Viceroy cannot see his way to take the vow, but if he approves of the scheme, I would like you to let me have a separate letter for publication.
('18', 11, 2, 16, 25562) Yours sincerely, M. K. GANDHI

('18', 11, 4, 18, 25620) 10. LETTER TO J. A. GUIDER
('18', 11, 5, 19, 25647) LABURNUM ROAD, BOMBAY, May 5, 1919
('18', 11, 6, 20, 25682) DEAR MR. GUIDER 1, Dame Rumour reports you to have been displeased with your staff for their inability to trace the educated men behind the tragedy at Ahmedabad, although I was able to do so.
('18', 11, 6, 21, 25874) The same lady further has it that you interpret educated Indians to mean only Vakils, Barristers, Doctors, etc.
('18', 11, 6, 22, 25986) I am, therefore, being torn to pieces by friends
('18', 11, 7, 23, 26035) 1 District Magistrate, Ahmedabad
('18', 12, 0, 1, 26068) VOL. 17 : 1 MAY, 1919 28 SEPTEMBER, 1919 13
('18', 12, 1, 2, 26112) and others for having created much mischief and caused needless suffering by use of unguarded language.
('18', 12, 1, 3, 26216) Naturally, I have to take the consequences of my words as I have of my deeds.
('18', 12, 1, 4, 26294) I do not know how far the rumours reported to me are true, but I would like to observe that the word I have used in the original is bhanela, and bhanela by no means means only a highly educated Indian.
('18', 12, 1, 5, 26496) For me, bhanela means all those who have received any education whatsoever, whether vernacular or English.
('18', 12, 1, 6, 26603) For instance, the anonymous author of an inflammatory vernacular poem which I have lately seen I would undoubtedly consider to be bhanela, i.e., educated and it is exactly in that sense that I have used the word educated in the translation of my speech.
('18', 12, 1, 7, 26857) As a matter of fact, if I had received evidence as to the complicity of highly educated men, I would certainly have not hesitated to make use of language to show that I meant such men.
('18', 12, 1, 8, 27042) My attention was directed yesterday to Mr. Pratts speech at Ahmedabad wherein he referred to the complicity of educated leaders.
('18', 12, 1, 9, 27171) I take it that he had not my speech in mind when he made the remark.
('18', 12, 1, 10, 27240) I may also add that by organized manner and design, I mean this: Some educated man or men believing in the efficacy of violence for securing redress saw the temper of the mob on Friday, immediately seized the situation and directed operations through gang leaders and that is exactly what I know from evidence before me happened on that awful day.
('18', 12, 1, 11, 27588) You can see therefore that it is possible for these men to remain absolutely concealed.
('18', 12, 2, 12, 27676) Yours sincerely,
('18', 12, 3, 13, 27693) From a photostat: S.N. 6590

('18', 15, 1, 2, 32643) 13. SATYAGRAHA LEAFLET NO.
('18', 15, 2, 3, 32670) May 6, 1919
('18', 15, 3, 4, 32682) SUNDAYS HARTAL : ITS RELIGIOUS SPIRIT
('18', 15, 4, 5, 32720) BROTHERS AND SISTERS, To declare a hartal is no small matter.
('18', 15, 4, 6, 32782) It requires strong reasons to support it.
('18', 15, 4, 7, 32824) Let us therefore examine the justification for it.
('18', 15, 4, 8, 32875) The citizens of Bombay are impatient to give some outward evidence of their deep affection for Mr. Horniman.
('18', 15, 4, 9, 32984) They can provide it in a striking manner by means of hartal.
('18', 15, 4, 10, 33045) Everybodys feelings will be tested thereby.
('18', 15, 4, 11, 33089) Moreover, hartal is an ancient Indian institution for expressing national sorrow and we can therefore demonstrate through hartal our grief over the deportation and hartal is the best method of marking our strong disapproval of the action of the Government.
('18', 15, 4, 12, 33346) It is a means, more powerful than monster meetings, of expressing national opinion.
('18', 15, 4, 13, 33430) Thus, we serve three purposes by hartal and all of them are so great that we do not expose ourselves to the charge of exaggeration in declaring hartal.
('18', 15, 4, 14, 33582) This much is clear that none of the purposes above named will be served if suspension of business is brought about through fear of public opprobrium or physical pressure.
('18', 15, 4, 15, 33753) If suspension were to be brought about by terrorism and if Mr. Horniman came to know [of] it, he could not but be displeased and grieved by the knowledge, and such artificial hartal would fail to produce any effect upon the Government.
('18', 15, 4, 16, 33989) Hartal forcibly brought about cannot be considered satyagrahi hartal.
('18', 15, 4, 17, 34059) In anything satyagrahi, there should be purity of motive, means and end.
('18', 15, 4, 18, 34132) I, therefore, hope that no man or woman who is unwilling to suspend business will in any way be interfered with, but that he or she will be guaranteed protection from any harm whatsoever.
('18', 15, 4, 19, 34320) I would far rather wish that people did not suspend business on Sunday in the city of Bombay and that the organizers were exposed to ridicule than that force was used upon a single person in order to make him suspend business.
('18', 15, 4, 20, 34547) In order to avoid all risk of commotion in Bombay on Sunday, the idea of holding public meetings has been discountenanced and all have been advised to remain indoors.
('18', 15, 4, 21, 34714) As all satyagraha activity should be guided by the religious spirit, I have suggested that we should fast for twenty four hours and devote the day to religious contemplation, and it is to be hoped that all the members of families including children and servants
('18', 16, 0, 1, 34976) VOL. 17 : 1 MAY, 1919 28 SEPTEMBER, 1919 17
('18', 16, 1, 2, 35020) will take part in the religious observance.
('18', 16, 1, 3, 35064) Hindus may have the Bhagavad Gita read to them.
('18', 16, 1, 4, 35112) It takes four hours to read through it with clear pronunciation and other Hindu religious books might be read in addition [to] or in place of it.
('18', 16, 1, 5, 35258) The Mahomedans and others may have their own scriptures read to them.
('18', 16, 1, 6, 35328) It will be a proper way of spending the day to read the stories of great satyagrahis such as Prahlad, Harishchandra, Mirabai, Imams Hasan and Hoosein, Socrates and others.
('18', 16, 1, 7, 35500) It will be opportune also to explain to family gatherings Mr. Hornimans title to our affection.
('18', 16, 1, 8, 35596) The chief thing to be remembered is that we may not fritter away next Sunday in playing cards, chowpat, gambling or in sheer laziness, but that it should be so spent as to make us better men and women for national service.
('18', 16, 1, 9, 35819) Better placed and well to do families will, I hope, invite such of their neighbours as may be poor, solitary or ignorant, to participate in the religious devotion.
('18', 16, 1, 10, 35983) A brotherly spirit is cultivated not by words but only by deeds.
('18', 16, 1, 11, 36048) Mr. Motilal Dahyabhai Zaveri of Kalbadevi Road has just dropped in and informed me that before the news of the declaration of hartal next Sunday, he had issued invitations for a wedding party on that day.
('18', 16, 1, 12, 36253) He also said there were many such parties to be given on the same day.
('18', 16, 1, 13, 36324) Mr. Motilal was most anxious that he and his friends should take part in the observance.
('18', 16, 1, 14, 36413) I venture to advise that so far as the religious part of the wedding ceremonial was concerned, it should be gone through without disturbance, but that dinner parties and other rejoicings might be postponed to Monday.
('18', 16, 1, 15, 36630) His patriotic affection for Mr. Horniman was such that he immediately accepted the advice and I tender it for the acceptance of those who may be similarly situated.
('18', 16, 2, 16, 36795) M. K. GANDHI

('18', 18, 5, 7, 38792) FRIENDS, I think we need not wait for anyone.
('18', 18, 5, 8, 38838) You may tell others who come what I shall tell you.
('18', 18, 5, 9, 38890) The step we are taking on Sunday is a very important one and involves a great responsibility.
('18', 18, 5, 10, 38984) Bombay has maintained the utmost patience during all this time and I should abuse it no longer.
('18', 18, 5, 11, 39080) I have had some anonymous letters in which the writers, forgetting their manners, have made harsh attacks on me for doing nothing so far about Mr. Horniman.
('18', 18, 5, 12, 39237) This has not hurt me in the least; on the contrary, I have been able to see peoples love for Mr. Horniman and I felt that I should provide expression to their feelings.
('18', 18, 5, 13, 39406) On the night following the day of Hornimans arrest, there was a strong move to call for a strike on the next day.

('18', 18, 5, 17, 39705) In these, I have said nothing to fill anyone with frustration.
('18', 18, 5, 18, 39768) We have done much during the last ten days.
('18', 18, 5, 19, 39812) In maintaining patience all these days, we have exercised great self control and Bombay deserves congratulations on that.

('18', 18, 5, 22, 40179) How can India ever forget a man who has always been for freedom for everyone?

('18', 18, 5, 24, 40385) It will be a great test for us.

('18', 19, 1, 2, 40684) preserve peace.

('18', 21, 2, 16, 47157) 17. SATYAGRAHA LEAFLET NO.
('18', 21, 3, 17, 47184) May 7, 1919
('18', 21, 4, 18, 47196) SUNDAYS HARTAL AND FASTING
('18', 21, 5, 19, 47223) BROTHERS AND SISTERS, By hartal, fasting and religious devotion on Sunday next, the people propose to demonstrate to the Government in terms of satya graha that it is not possible for them to bring about true contentment by force of arms.
('18', 21, 5, 20, 47462) So long as the Rowlatt legislation is not withdrawn, so long as the Government continue to suppress men like Mr. Hor niman who carry on innocent agitations against such acts of the
('18', 21, 6, 21, 47643) 1 Gandhiji then asked the audience if they had any doubts.
('18', 21, 6, 22, 47702) What follows is in reply to a question whether they would not do better to assemble, after bath, in a temple or at Chowpatty.
('18', 22, 0, 1, 47828) VOL. 17 : 1 MAY, 1919 28 SEPTEMBER, 1919 23
('18', 22, 1, 2, 47872) Government, not only is true contentment impossible, but discontent must increase.
('18', 22, 1, 3, 47955) All the world over a true peace depends not upon gunpowder but upon pure justice.
('18', 22, 1, 4, 48037) When Government perpetrate injustice and fortify it by the use of arms, such acts are a sign of anger and they add injustice to injustice.
('18', 22, 1, 5, 48176) If people also become angry by reason of such acts on the part of the Government, they resort to violence and the result is bad for both, mutual ill will increases.
('18', 22, 1, 6, 48341) But whenever people regard particular acts of the Government as unjust and express their strong disapproval by self suffering, the Govern ment cannot help granting redress.
('18', 22, 1, 7, 48514) This is the way of satyagraha and the people of Bombay will have an opportunity on Sunday next of giving expression in a clean manner to such disapproval.
('18', 22, 1, 8, 48669) A hartal brought about voluntarily and without pressure is a powerful means of showing popular disapproval, but fasting is even more so.
('18', 22, 1, 9, 48806) When people fast in a religious spirit and thus demonstrate their grief before God, it receives a certain response.
('18', 22, 1, 10, 48922) Hardest hearts are impressed by it.
('18', 22, 1, 11, 48958) Fasting is regarded by all religions as a great discipline.
('18', 22, 1, 12, 49018) Those who voluntarily fast become gentle and purified by it.
('18', 22, 1, 13, 49079) A pure fast is a very powerful prayer.
('18', 22, 1, 14, 49118) It is no small thing for lakhs of people voluntarily to abstain from food and such a fast is a satyagrahi fast.
('18', 22, 1, 15, 49230) It ennobles individuals and nations.
('18', 22, 1, 16, 49267) In it there should be no intention of exercising undue pressure upon the Government.
('18', 22, 1, 17, 49352) But we do observe that like so many other good acts, this one of fasting too is sometimes abused.
('18', 22, 1, 18, 49450) In India we often see beggars threatening to fast, fasting, or pretending to fast, until they receive what they ask for.
('18', 22, 1, 19, 49571) This is duragrahi fasting and the person so fasting degrades himself and it will be the proper thing to let such people fast.
('18', 22, 1, 20, 49697) It is false kindness to give anything under pressure of such fasting.
('18', 22, 1, 21, 49767) If it were to be otherwise, fasting may be resorted to even for securing unlawful demands.
('18', 22, 1, 22, 49858) Where it is a question of determining the justice or otherwise of a particular act, there is no room for any other force but that of reason regulated by the voice of conscience.
('18', 22, 1, 23, 50036) The coming fast is thus in no way to be interpreted as designed to put pressure upon the Government.
('18', 22, 2, 24, 50137) M. K. GANDHI

('18', 24, 6, 7, 51843) SUNDAYS HARTAL
('18', 24, 7, 8, 51858) TRUE MEANING OF BHAGAVAD GITAS TEACHINGS
('18', 24, 8, 9, 51899) BROTHERS AND SISTERS, Even The Times of India, which is ordinarily regarded as the impartial newspaper, has seen fit to ridicule the forthcoming hartal and to distrust the religious character of fasting.
('18', 24, 8, 10, 52103) It is our duty patiently to endure the ridicule and distrust.
('18', 24, 8, 11, 52165) We can turn both into repentance by our own action, i.e., by observing the hartal in a satyagrahi spirit and by true religious devotion.
('18', 24, 8, 12, 52302) But the more grievous criticism of this well known newspaper consists in misinterpreting our calmness and inferring from it that we have felt no grief over Mr. Hornimans separation.
('18', 24, 8, 13, 52484) By observing full hartal on Sunday in a quiet manner and by devoting the day to sincere religious contem plation, we can demonstrate the mistake made by The Times of India.
('18', 24, 8, 14, 52657) I shall now endeavour to consider in all humility a doubt raised by some Hindu friends regarding the meaning of the Bhagavad Gita.
('18', 24, 8, 15, 52788) They say that in the Bhagavad Gita Sri Krishna has encouraged Arjuna to slay his relations and they therefore argue that there is warrant in that work for violence and that there is no satyagraha in it.
('18', 24, 8, 16, 52991) Now the Bhagavad Gita is not a historical work, it is a great religious book, summing up the teaching of all religions.
('18', 24, 8, 17, 53111) The poet has seized the occasion of the war between the Pandavas and the Kauravas on the field of Kurukshetra for drawing attention to the war going on in our bodies between the forces of Good (Pandavas) and the forces of Evil (Kauravas) and has shown that the latter should be destroyed and there should be no remissness in carrying on the battle against the forces of Evil, mistaking them through ignorance for forces of Good.
('18', 24, 9, 18, 53540) 1 The reply to this received from Mrs. E. C. Row read: My husband has made the greatest mistake of his life if he wrote to you....We are no Indians.
('18', 25, 0, 1, 53689) 26 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('18', 25, 1, 2, 53730) In Islam, Christianity, Judaism, it is a war between God and Satan, in Zoroastrianism between Aurmazd and Ahriman.
('18', 25, 1, 3, 53845) To confuse the description of this universally acknowledged spiritual war with a momentary world strife is to call holy unholy.
('18', 25, 1, 4, 53973) We, who are saturated with the teachings of the Bhagavad Gita but who do not pretend to any special spiritual qualifications, do not draw out sword against our relations whenever they perpetrate injustice but we win them over by our affection for them.
('18', 25, 1, 5, 54226) If the physical interpretation alluded to of the Bhagavad Gita be correct, we sin against it in not inflicting physical punishment upon our relatives whom we consider to have done us injustice.
('18', 25, 1, 6, 54420) Everywhere in that Divine Song, we note the following advice given to Arjuna: Fight without anger, conquer the two great enemies, desire and anger, be the same to friend and foe; physical objects cause pleasure and pain, they are fleeting; endure them.
('18', 25, 1, 7, 54673) That one cannot strike down an adversary without anger is universal experience.
('18', 25, 1, 8, 54753) Only an Arujna who destroys the devil within him can live without attachment.
('18', 25, 1, 9, 54831) It was Ramdas brought up in the teaching of the Bhagavad Gita who not only endured the lashes of a wrongdoer but actually produced for him a Jagir.
('18', 25, 1, 10, 54979) Narsinh Mehta, the first poet of Gujarat and the prince among bhaktas, was nurtured in the Bhagavad Gita teaching.
('18', 25, 1, 11, 55094) He conquered his enemies only by love and has given through one single poem of matchless beauty the great text of their conduct to his fellow Vaishnavas.
('18', 25, 1, 12, 55248) That encouragement from violence can be deduced from the Bhagavad Gita demonstrates the deadliness of Kaliyuga.
('18', 25, 1, 13, 55360) It is only too true that we often find an echo of our sentiments in what we read and see.
('18', 25, 1, 14, 55450) If it is true that God made men in his own image, it is equally true that man makes God also in his own image.
('18', 25, 1, 15, 55561) I have found nothing but love in every page of the Gita and I hope and pray that everyone will have similar experience of Sunday.
('18', 25, 2, 16, 55691) M. K. GANDHI

('18', 27, 4, 5, 57605) 23. SPEECH AT WOMENS MEETING, BOMBAY
('18', 27, 5, 6, 57642) May 8, 1919
('18', 27, 6, 7, 57654) DEAR SISTERS, Not being well today, I shall talk to you sitting.
('18', 27, 6, 8, 57719) Those among you who are educated will have read about the swadeshi vow in the papers.
('18', 27, 6, 9, 57805) The one thing I have been saying over and over again ever since my return from South Africa is this: So long as women in India do not take equal part with men in the affairs of the world and in religious and political matters, we shall not see Indias star rising.
('18', 27, 6, 10, 58069) To take an illustration, men who suffer from paralysis of one side of the body can do no work.
('18', 27, 6, 11, 58164) Similarly, if women do not share in mens tasks, the country is bound to remain in a wretched state.
('18', 27, 6, 12, 58264) What conditions can we expect in a country where the women remain ignorant of the joys and sorrows of men?
('18', 27, 6, 13, 58371) I feel tempted to talk about all these matters, but I do not have the time to do so.
('18', 27, 6, 14, 58456) I want you to make your full contribution to the cause about which I shall speak today.
('18', 27, 6, 15, 58544) All I mean is that it is essential that women make their contribution to the developments taking place in the country.
('18', 27, 6, 16, 58663) This requires no knowledge of letters.
('18', 27, 6, 17, 58702) It is not true that, without such knowledge, one cannot take part in national work.
('18', 27, 6, 18, 58786) Women work in their homes well enough.
('18', 27, 6, 19, 58825) I have to work among farmers and weavers.
('18', 27, 6, 20, 58867) We can inspire more enthusiasm in them than in the educated classes.
('18', 27, 6, 21, 58936) In the satyagraha in Kheda district, if men worked, women helped as much.
('18', 27, 6, 22, 59010) Had they not done so, had they yielded to fear and held back the men, where would we have been?
('18', 27, 6, 23, 59106) The swadeshi vow, too, cannot be kept fully if women do not help.
('18', 27, 6, 24, 59172) Men alone will be able to do nothing in the matter.
('18', 27, 6, 25, 59224) They can have no control over the children; that is the womens sphere.
('18', 27, 6, 26, 59295) To look after children, to dress them, is the mothers duty and, therefore, it is necessary that women should be fired with the spirit of swadeshi.
('18', 27, 6, 27, 59442) So long as that does not happen, men will not be in a position to take the vow.
('18', 27, 6, 28, 59522) Woman is the mistress of the home and lives in royal style; if this
('18', 28, 0, 1, 59590) VOL. 17 : 1 MAY, 1919 28 SEPTEMBER, 1919 29
('18', 28, 1, 2, 59634) does not change, what can man do?
('18', 28, 1, 3, 59668) Womens clothing costs more than mens.
('18', 28, 1, 4, 59706) India has to part with 60 crores of rupees [annually] to foreign countries.
('18', 28, 1, 5, 59782) Four crores are wasted in this manner on silk and the remaining 56 crores on cotton fabrics.
('18', 28, 1, 6, 59875) India has a population of 30 crores and this means that every person throws away, on an average, Rs. 2/ [annually] over foreign cloth.
('18', 28, 1, 7, 60010) Further, there are three crores in India who get only one meal a day.
('18', 28, 1, 8, 60080) Formerly, our mothers and sisters used to spin in the homes and that helped preserve Indias self respect and honour.
('18', 28, 1, 9, 60197) That work is now taken over by the mills.
('18', 28, 1, 10, 60239) Outside the Bombay Presidency, women are now observing the swadeshi vow.
('18', 28, 1, 11, 60312) In Madras, Bengal and other parts, cloth for women is made by Indian weavers.
('18', 28, 1, 12, 60390) Here, however, women generally use expensive foreign cloth.
('18', 28, 1, 13, 60450) It is men who are responsible for the idea that women must have English cloth.
('18', 28, 1, 14, 60529) It is they who tell women about such cloth and suggest that it is good to wear.
('18', 28, 1, 15, 60609) This has given the women their wrong idea, but we must correct it now.
('18', 28, 1, 16, 60680) We ought not to allow our own art to perish, running after foreign art.
('18', 28, 1, 17, 60752) All this has had unhappy consequences and we must help India to get rid of them.
('18', 28, 1, 18, 60833) However bad the climate and soil of our country, we do not run away from it.
('18', 28, 1, 19, 60910) We should use cloth made in our country, however coarse it may be.
('18', 28, 1, 20, 60977) The eye will get used to it by and by.
('18', 28, 1, 21, 61016) It is the soul we should care to make beautiful.
('18', 28, 1, 22, 61065) We need not go after external adornment.
('18', 28, 1, 23, 61106) Our country, moreover, is miserably poor.
('18', 28, 1, 24, 61148) We have frequent famines.
('18', 28, 1, 25, 61174) The plague and cholera are ever with us.
('18', 28, 1, 26, 61215) If the country were really rich, there would be some propriety in our living in style.
('18', 28, 1, 27, 61302) At present, however, when there are some who do not even get enough clothing, this ostentation is not in good taste.
('18', 28, 1, 28, 61419) Bear in mind that, if we do not act in this manner now, we shall be compelled by circumstances to do so.
('18', 28, 1, 29, 61524) Posterity will feel sad for us and the country will grow poorer.
('18', 28, 1, 30, 61589) If you do not want the country to remain poor, observe the swadeshi vow, and wear swadeshi cloth, however coarse it be.
('18', 28, 1, 31, 61709) There was a time when a piece of Dacca muslin could be packed into a little box and yet served to cover ones nakedness well enough.

('18', 32, 1, 2, 67575) 27. SPEECH ON KHILAFAT, BOMBAY 1
('18', 32, 2, 3, 67608) May 9, 1919 What the Chairman has said about me is true, for I have, ever since the days of my youth, had a longing to see differences between Hindus and Mahomedans obliterated.
('18', 32, 2, 4, 67786) When I was in South Africa, I came in close touch with Muslim brethren.
('18', 32, 2, 5, 67858) I went there in connection with a Mahomedan case and there I was able to learn their habits, thoughts and aspirations.
('18', 32, 2, 6, 67977) In 1914, I sailed from South Africa, reaching London on the 6th of August, i.e., two days after the dec laration of war between England and Germany.
('18', 32, 2, 7, 68126) Soon after, I read a series of articles in the [London] Times, speculating on Turkeys choice.
('18', 32, 2, 8, 68220) I found the Mahomedans residing in London equally agitated.
('18', 32, 2, 9, 68280) One morning we read the news that Turkey had joined Germany.
('18', 32, 2, 10, 68341) I had no leisure then to study the Turkish question and pronounce judgement on the Turkish action, I simply prayed that India might be saved from the turmoil.
('18', 32, 2, 11, 68500) Having had to explain to the Mahomedan friends in South Africa the events of the Tripolitan war and having understood their sentiments, I had no difficulty in gauging Maho medan sentiment over the Turkish choice.
('18', 32, 2, 12, 68713) Theirs became a much difficult position.
('18', 32, 2, 13, 68754) I landed next year in India with ideas of Hindu Mahomedan unity and the Turkish question and I felt when I landed that I would like to assist in securing a proper solution of these questions.
('18', 32, 2, 14, 68946) There are two things to which I am devoting my life permanent unity between Hindus and Mahomedans, and satyagraha; to satyagraha probably more, for it covers a much wider field.
('18', 32, 2, 15, 69124) It is an all embracing movement and if we accept the law of satyagraha, unity will come of itself.
('18', 32, 2, 16, 69223) The question that I have to answer this evening is: How can I help in having a Mahomedan question emerging out of the late war properly solved?
('18', 32, 2, 17, 69367) After my arrival in India, I began to find out good Mahomedan leaders.
('18', 32, 2, 18, 69438) My desire was satisfied when I reached
('18', 32, 3, 19, 69477) 1 Delivered in Gujarati at a special meeting of the Anjuman Ziaul Islam under the presidentship of M. T. Kadarbhai, Barrister at law, to consider the question of the Caliphate.
('18', 32, 3, 20, 69654) A large number of Muslims was present.
('18', 32, 3, 21, 69693) Gandhiji, Jamnadas Dwarkadas and Shankarlal Banker were among those specially invited.
('18', 32, 3, 22, 69780) Kadarbhai, in introducing Gandhiji to the.
('18', 32, 3, 23, 69823) meeting, said that the latter had throughout his life tried to see that the differences between the Hindus and the Mahomedans were obliterated, and that his passive resistance struggle in South Africa was principally for the Mahomedans, because three fourths of the Indian commerce was in the hands of the Mahomedans and that he had done in one day what years of British rule could not achieve in the union of the Hindus and the Mahomedans.
('18', 33, 0, 1, 70264) 34 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('18', 33, 1, 2, 70305) Delhi, and found the Brothers Ali, whom I had the privilege of knowing before.
('18', 33, 1, 3, 70384) It was a question of love at first sight between us.
('18', 33, 1, 4, 70437) When I met Dr. Ansari, the circle of Mahomedan friends widened and at last it even included Maulana Abdul Bari of Lucknow.
('18', 33, 1, 5, 70560) I have discussed the Mahomedan question with all these friends and many other Mahomedans throughout India and I feel that this question is the greatest of all, greater even than that of the repeal of the Rowlatt legislation; for it affects the religious susceptibilities of millions of Mahomedans.
('18', 33, 1, 6, 70858) It is a remarkable fact, but it is true that Mahomedan women and children too are interested in this question.
('18', 33, 1, 7, 70969) There is at the present moment suspicion, deep rooted in the minds of the Mahomedans, regarding the intentions of the Imperial Government on this question.
('18', 33, 1, 8, 71125) Though the Viceroy is not unmindful of the gravity of the situation, I do feel that a declaration of British policy is necessary in order to conciliate the Mahomedan sentiment.
('18', 33, 1, 9, 71302) So far as I am aware, there are three points involved: first, the one regarding the Khilaphate and the possession of Turkey; second, regarding Holy Mecca and Medina; third, regarding Palestine.
('18', 33, 1, 10, 71496) Briefly put, your contention is that the pre war status should be restored.
('18', 33, 1, 11, 71572) With the Mahomedan countrymen, the temporal and spiritual power go hand in hand.
('18', 33, 1, 12, 71653) I can, therefore, understand the Mahomedan sentiment against any dismemberment of Turkey.
('18', 33, 1, 13, 71743) But it has been stated by The Times of India amongst others that there is as yet no authoritative and representative statement of the Mahomedan claim.
('18', 33, 1, 14, 71894) You and you alone can mend this omission.
('18', 33, 1, 15, 71936) There should be a calm, dispassionate and reasoned statement of the Mahomedan claim.
('18', 33, 1, 16, 72021) In my humble opinion, you should set forth your minimum demands in such a way as to appeal to any impartial student of such matters.
('18', 33, 1, 17, 72154) Time is running fast and unless you make a move at once in the desired direction, it may be too late to do anything; for the League of Nations is making rapid progress, as rapid as it is possible to make in view of world interests that are to be affected by its deliberations.
('18', 33, 1, 18, 72431) And when you have drawn up the statement of your claim, you have to see how to enforce it.
('18', 33, 1, 19, 72522) It may be asked why I, a Hindu, bother my head about the Mahomedan question.
('18', 33, 1, 20, 72599) The answer is that as you are my neighbours and my countrymen, it is my duty to share your sorrows.
('18', 33, 1, 21, 72699) I cannot talk about Hindu Mahomedan unity and fail in giving effect to the idea when the test has come.
('18', 33, 1, 22, 72803) And you know that I touched the Mahomedan question in my published letter addressed to H. E. the
('18', 34, 0, 1, 72900) VOL. 17 : 1 MAY, 1919 28 SEPTEMBER, 1919 35
('18', 34, 1, 2, 72944) Viceroy immediately after the war conference that was held at Delhi.
('18', 34, 2, 3, 73013) Since then I have never failed, whenever the occasion has arisen, to submit my views to the proper quarters.
('18', 34, 2, 4, 73122) It now remains for me to consider how your claim may be enforced.
('18', 34, 2, 5, 73188) Naturally the chosen method is to make representations to the Government.
('18', 34, 2, 6, 73262) Sometimes the Government do not see eye to eye with us.
('18', 34, 2, 7, 73318) What are we to do under such circumstances?
('18', 34, 2, 8, 73362) If we had the franchise and responsible Government, we could by our vote turn that Government out of power.
('18', 34, 2, 9, 73470) But in the absence of any such effective methods of making our will felt, what are we to do?
('18', 34, 2, 10, 73563) When people have become enraged against governments for a deliberate failure to carry out their wishes, they have resorted to violence and I know that many consider that violence is the only remedy open to them when ordinary agitation has failed.
('18', 34, 2, 11, 73810) This is an age long remedy.
('18', 34, 2, 12, 73838) I consider it to be barbarous and I have endeavoured to place before the people and the Government another remedy which does away with violence in any shape or form and is infinitely more successful than the latter.
('18', 34, 2, 13, 74054) I feel we are not justified in resorting to violence for asserting our rights.
('18', 34, 2, 14, 74133) It is noble by far to diethan to kill.
('18', 34, 2, 15, 74172) Had it not been for my talks with Barisahib, I would have hesitated to talk to you on a subject which is deeply religious.
('18', 34, 2, 16, 74295) But he assured me that there was warrant enough for satyagraha in the Holy Koran.
('18', 34, 2, 17, 74377) He agreed with the interpretation of the Koran to the effect that whilst violence under certain well defined circumstances is permissible, self restraint is dearer to God than violence, and that is the law of love.
('18', 34, 2, 18, 74592) That is satyagrahaviolence is a concession to human weakness, satyagraha is an obligation.
('18', 34, 2, 19, 74683) Even from a practical standpoint, it is easy enough to see that violence can do no good and can only do infinite harm, as we have seen in Ahmedabad and Viramgam.
('18', 34, 2, 20, 74845) You will have further illustration on Sunday.
('18', 34, 2, 21, 74891) I have advised a satyagraha hartal accompanied by fasting and prayer.
('18', 34, 2, 22, 74961) I hope that you will all join the great demonstration of honour, sorrow and protesthonour to an Englishman who has served India so well and so faithfully, sorrow that he has been deported and protest against the ill advised action of the Government.
('18', 34, 2, 23, 75211) These are common causes among us and I hope that you will take your full share in this demonstration.
('18', 34, 2, 24, 75313) Its success lies in its being absolutely peaceful and voluntary and if we are that we need neither the police nor the military.
('18', 34, 2, 25, 75441) When satyagraha becomes the accepted
('18', 34, 3, 26, 75478) 1 Vide Letter to Viceroy 29 4 1918.

('18', 35, 1, 2, 75555) creed of India, the aeroplanes will cease to frighten us and when we provide no occasion for the use of machine guns at Colaba and elsewhere, they would be overlaid with earth, grass will grow upon them and our children will play upon them.
('18', 35, 2, 3, 75796) Maulvi Abdul Raoof then moved the following resolution:
('18', 35, 3, 4, 75852) Resolved that the Viceroy and Governor General of India be requested to announce a British policy in concert with the Right Hon.
('18', 35, 3, 5, 75981) the Secretary of State for India and the Prime Minister, which may be laid before the Peace Conference through the British representatives whose object would be (I) to settle the question of the Khalifate in accordance with the wishes of the Muslims in India; (2) to entrust the guardianship of the holy places, such as Mecca, Medina, Jerusalem, Najaf, Kerbala, Kaxomaina, Baghdad, etc., to the Khalifatul Mussalmin; (3) to desist from the proposed dismemberment of the Turkish Empire; (4) that Constantinople, which has been the seat of the Khalifate for four centuries and which is predominantly Muslim by faith and Turkish by race must remain the capital of the Turkish Empire.
('18', 35, 3, 6, 76662) That the fulfilment of the above questions in their entirety will bring about the restoration of normal feelings among the Muslims of India, and remove the tremendous discontent and unrest that exist, and that therefore this meeting earnestly prays that His Majestys Britannic Government will cause a declaration to be issued at an early date in India, bearing on the question, as such declarat on will bring forth an era of peace, calmness and tranquillity so very essential to the good and orderly governance of India.
('18', 35, 4, 7, 77183) The resolution was carried.

('18', 37, 6, 7, 79618) 31. LETTER TO ANNIE BESANT
('18', 37, 7, 8, 79645) BOMBAY, May10, 1919
('18', 37, 8, 9, 79665) DEAR MRS.
('18', 37, 8, 10, 79675) BESANT, I thank you for your note.
('18', 37, 8, 11, 79710) Dr. Subramaniam 1 was not overpersuaded, so far as I am aware, by anybody.
('18', 37, 8, 12, 79785) He had published his interview about satyagraha before he saw me.
('18', 37, 8, 13, 79851) He took the pledge of his own free will, saying that he had been all his life a satyagrahi.
('18', 37, 8, 14, 79943) I remember the occasion during your internment when I met him at his bungalow; many of your followers were there and they, one and all, accepted the plan that was unfolded by me before them.
('18', 37, 8, 15, 80134) I understood then from them all that satyagraha had your full approval, and that you had advised that it should be conducted under my guidance.
('18', 37, 8, 16, 80278) It saddens me to see in your writings a new Mrs. Besant, and not the old Mrs. Besant who in utter disregard of man made laws, whether social or political, stood for Truth against the whole world.
('18', 37, 8, 17, 80474) It is tragic to think that you should now turn back upon your own teachings and accuse me of leading young men of good impulses to break their most solemn pledges.
('18', 37, 8, 18, 80638) I cannot accept the charge, but I would certainly advise everyone to break all the pledges he might have taken if they are contrary to Truth.
('18', 37, 8, 19, 80780) You deprive a fellow being of his or her human dignity when you interpose between him and his conscience,
('18', 37, 9, 20, 80886) 1 Sir S. Subramania lyer
('18', 38, 0, 1, 80911) VOL. 17 : 1 MAY, 1919 28 SEPTEMBER, 1919 39
('18', 38, 1, 2, 80955) an outsider, no matter how high placed in spirituality he may appear to be.
('18', 38, 1, 3, 81031) Those of your followers who obey the voice of conscience in preference even to your own instructions are loyal to you as truly as Prahlad was to his father.
('18', 38, 1, 4, 81188) Surely, your past life is a striking demonstration of the truth of my remark.
('18', 38, 1, 5, 81266) Is not every reformer an avowed law breaker?
('18', 38, 1, 6, 81311) But I do not want to strive with you.
('18', 38, 1, 7, 81349) I shall continue to think of the Mrs. Besant whom from my youth I had come to regard as a great and living illustration of fearlessness, courage and truth You have written your note in grief.
('18', 38, 1, 8, 81541) You do not know what greater grief you have caused and are causing to those who know your services to India and who love you for them.
('18', 38, 1, 9, 81676) Should you want to see me, I am at your service.

('18', 40, 4, 16, 85391) 35. SATYAGRAHA LEAFLET NO.
('18', 40, 5, 17, 85418) May 12, 1919
('18', 40, 6, 18, 85431) PEACEFUL HARTAL: BOMBAYS WORTHY EXAMPLE
('18', 40, 7, 19, 85471) BROTHERS AND SISTERS, Bombay covered itself with glory by preserving perfect calm, and the citizens have shown by their peaceful hartal [that] they have understood a portion of satyagraha.
('18', 40, 7, 20, 85660) They have done true honour to Mr. Horniman and demonstrated to the Government that they disapprove of his deportation.
('18', 40, 7, 21, 85779) Bombay has set a worthy example to the whole of India.
('18', 40, 7, 22, 85834) It is a matter of pride for Bombay, from the satyagraha standpoint, that some shops were open.
('18', 40, 7, 23, 85929) This fact proved the voluntary character of the hartal.
('18', 40, 7, 24, 85985) Many causes contributed to the success of this remarkable demonstration, but the chief among them was the performance of their duty by volunteers under Mr. Vithaldas Jerajani.
('18', 40, 7, 25, 86161) They had commenced operations from the commencement of the talk of hartal, and we had the results of their efforts yesterday.
('18', 40, 7, 26, 86287) Our thanks are due also to the police.
('18', 40, 7, 27, 86326) If aggressive military disposit ions had been made, the people would have become excited and the task of preserving peace would have been much more difficult.
('18', 40, 7, 28, 86485) A nation enjoying or desiring to enjoy swaraj must possess the
('18', 41, 0, 1, 86548) 42 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('18', 41, 1, 2, 86589) following four attributes: (1) The police should be the least needed for self protection and there should be concord between them and the people; (2) jails should be the least patronized; (3) the hospitals should have few cases; and (4) the law courts should have the least work.
('18', 41, 1, 3, 86869) Where people do violence, commit crimes, and not exercising control over their senses and committing a breach of natures laws become diseased and engage in perpetual quarrels resulting in law suits, they are not free but in bondage.
('18', 41, 1, 4, 87102) We shall learn the first chapter of swaraj and liberty when India adopts the example of Bombay as a permanent way of life.
('18', 41, 2, 5, 87225) M. K. GANDHI

('18', 41, 5, 9, 87412) 36. LETTER TO REV.
('18', 41, 5, 10, 87431) M. WELLS BRANCH
('18', 41, 6, 11, 87447) LABURNUM ROAD, GAMDEVI, BOMBAY, May 12, 1919
('18', 41, 7, 12, 87492) DEAR REV.
('18', 41, 7, 13, 87502) BRANCH 1, I thank you for your letter 2. I think that some of the principles of Christianity are bound to leave their impress upon the future development of India.
('18', 41, 7, 14, 87666) If by the modern movement you mean the agitation for Reforms, it is a result of modern civilization and modern education.
('18', 41, 7, 15, 87788) If by the modern movement you mean satyagraha, it is an extended application of the ancient teaching.
('18', 41, 7, 16, 87890) I do not think that either has anything to do with Christian teaching.
('18', 41, 7, 17, 87961) I believe that Jesus Christ was one of the greatest teachers of the world.
('18', 41, 7, 18, 88036) I consider him as an incarnation in the Hindu sense of the
('18', 41, 8, 19, 88095) 1 Manager, Lucknow School of Commerce, Lucknow 2 Dated 9 5 1919, wherein three questions were asked.
('18', 41, 8, 20, 88196) S.N. 6608
('18', 42, 0, 1, 88206) VOL. 17 : 1 MAY, 1919 28 SEPTEMBER, 1919 43
('18', 42, 1, 2, 88250) I do not believe him to be the World Saviour in the sense in which orthodox Christianity understands the expression but he was a saviour in the same sense as Buddha, Zoroaster, Mohammed, and many other teachers were.
('18', 42, 1, 3, 88467) In other words, I do not believe in the exclusive divinity of Jesus.
('18', 42, 1, 4, 88536) The Sermon on the Mount left a deep impression on my mind when I read it.
('18', 42, 1, 5, 88610) I do believe with you that the real meaning of the teachings of Jesus will be delivered from India.
('18', 42, 1, 6, 88710) I have moved among thousands upon thousands of Indians, but I have not found any secret follower of Jesus.
('18', 42, 1, 7, 88817) This does not mean that there are not secret followers of his in India.
('18', 42, 1, 8, 88889) But there could not be many.
('18', 42, 1, 9, 88918) However, I entirely subscribe to your opinion that such followers should come out in the open and declare their faith.
('18', 42, 2, 10, 89037) Yours sincerely,
